summary: This is a Department of Justice case overview memo dated November 5, 2020, prepared for a Deputy Attorney General (DAG) meeting. It outlines anticipated charges and investigative steps related to the Epstein case, focusing on the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell and plea negotiations with another co-conspirator.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiring to entice minors to travel for sexual abuse in connection with helping Jeffrey Epstein. Her trial is set for July, and discovery and motions are ongoing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure whose sexual abuse of many victims Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with assisting.

persons.name: Relliwe
persons.context: Another Epstein co-conspirator who scheduled sexual massages with minors for Epstein and was also a victim of his abuse. The memo indicates they are in plea negotiations for an obstruction of justice count.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring with and helping Epstein to abuse his victims, including participating in acts of abuse herself.
Relliwe is described as an Epstein co-conspirator who scheduled hundreds of sexual massages with minors for him.
The memo states Relliwe was also a victim of Epstein's sexual abuse.

events.title: DAG Meeting Case Overview
events.description: A meeting or briefing for the Deputy Attorney General to review the status of the Epstein-related cases, including charges against Ghislaine Maxwell and plea negotiations.

events.title: Charging of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: In the summer of 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with conspiring to entice minors to travel for sexual abuse in connection with helping Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Motions in Maxwell Case
events.description: Motions in the U.S. v. Maxwell case are scheduled for December 2020. The defendant is pressing for the identity of specific victims.

events.title: Scheduled Trial for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is set for July 2021.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged in the summer of 2020 with conspiring to entice minors to travel for sexual abuse in connection with helping Jeffrey Epstein, with a trial set for July 2021.
The Maxwell case focuses on three specific victims who traveled to be abused by Epstein, including instances where Maxwell herself participated in the abuse.

Plea negotiations are ongoing with another Epstein co-conspirator, referred to as 'Relliwe,' who scheduled sexual massages with minors for Epstein but was also a victim of his abuse, potentially for an obstruction of justice count.
The defendant (Maxwell) is pressing for the identity of the specific victims in her case, which the memo notes could generate significant press if she is successful.
This document is a high-level DOJ case overview prepared for a Deputy Attorney General meeting, indicating ongoing federal prosecution efforts related to the Epstein case.
